lexUnit.name: exhausted.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: feeling unable or disinclined to perform further exertion.

sentence.text: Next morning the Singphos are exhausted , but not the captured elephants .
I was exhausted , and slept for two hours .
Once at the hospital , Liz was taken to the delivery room immediately and Mark went off to find the waiting room , which was full of exhausted partners who 'd been there for hours .
She was exhausted , she was close to tears or laughter , she was probably getting drunk , topping up on last night 's alcohol .
Once again the seriousness of the illness was known to only a small group who concocted an official bulletin stating the Prime Minister was exhausted and needed a prolonged rest .
It led to the highest floor where we found an Iraqi soldier firing an automatic rifle through a narrow aperture in a pile of sandbags , reloading and firing his weapon until he became exhausted .
The danger was then , not that she would sink immediately , but that the crew would become exhausted from continual pumping and general misery , after which anything might happen .
True , his western armies were pushing forward rapidly as planned , but danger lay even in this , for the troops were becoming exhausted and famished as they moved far ahead of their supply trains .
Tess became more and more exhausted and was near to fainting when they finally stopped .
By the end of the day , after more lessons , a cold shower , a cold dinner and two hours of homework , Endill felt exhausted .
I feel exhausted all the time from the sheer hard physical work and never getting a proper break .
The evening shift of medics took over from their exhausted colleagues at 1800 hours .

Geraldine Bedell , writing in the Independent newspaper , described what happened when the senior partner of a law firm was confronted with tears from an exhausted female at the end of a marathon deal .
I lay rigid , willing myself into the exhausted stupor that I knew was there waiting to engulf me again .
He was unshaven and looked exhausted .
The three men looked at each other with expressionless , exhausted eyes .
Stephen looked round the shellhole at the exhausted faces of the Lancashire men .
He looked exhausted , and hungry , and very fierce .
She was imprisoned in a long silk gown , her face pale and rather beautiful , with dark circles around deep , exhausted eyes .
This common practice allows the exhausted mothers to get some sleep after giving birth .
His exhausted mother was finally persuaded to rest in a hotel .
I 'm exhausted when I get back , I 'm telling you .
The children come in , fling their things down , jump over furniture and I 'm exhausted when they go .
Some Arabs in a tent gave them a little water and then the exhausted men finally stumbled into an outpost of the King 's Dragoon Guards .
They stood watching the Natural Leader shepherd the little children and their exhausted parents into the charabanc .
Towards dusk we were galvanised into action by a hail from shore , our boat was despatched and soon some very tired shepherds with their exhausted dogs flopped over the gunwale .
But the exhausted doctors say it 's not enough … and they want the government to honour its promise …
She says : ` I 'm pretty exhausted and feel a bit giddy and my legs ache .
